snippet: Companies have been told to buy and install hardware to log the traffic of computers, block selected Web sites and connect with local police servers.
abstract: Chinese cyberpolice have ordered several companies, including joint ventures involving American corporations, to install hardware to help monitor Internet use ahead of Communist Party leadership transition; actions, part of campaign against information deemed threatening to party rule, appear aimed at plugging gaps in China's nexus of surveillance and censorship.
lead_paragraph: Companies have been told to buy and install hardware to log the traffic of computers, block selected Web sites and connect with local police servers.

headline.seo: China Pressures Businesses to Help Censor Web
headline.main: Chinese Authorities Putting Pressure on Businesses to Help Censor the Web
headline.print_headline: Chinese Authorities Putting Pressure on Businesses to Help Censor the Web
